page.title: 02HISTORY OF ABERAERON
page.content: The town of{Aberaeron}had its beginnings in the early 19th century. Although a castle was built here in {1148}and the district had been known as Aberaeron, the town itself is less than two centuries old. The modern town dates from{1808}when { {Alban Gwynne} obtained Parliament's permission to{"rebuild, enlarge, {improve and maintain"}the quay and the harbour. Then in 1811 he announced that he would{"give liberal {encouragement to such persons as might {be disposed to take building leases {near the harbour". Development from then onwards was swift. An increase in sea trade, and a flourishing ship building industry attracted many from the rural hinterland. They brought with them their skills, religions and customs.
